channel.title: Half-Life Look-Alikes
channel.description:
I remember reading a thread on these forums a while ago about what actors would play what role in a Half-Life movie, if one was ever made. I couldn't find that thread, but I found something that I think would contribute to it nicely, so I'm posting it here.
I found Barney. I'm making this thread in the hopes that other people can post links to people who really look like HL characters.
Notes: This youtube video is a small part of a movie called Lawnmower Man. If you skip to 1:53 in the video and watch for a couple of seconds, you will see a guy who (in my opinion) looks A LOT like Barney from HL2. Now, I know that him playing Barney isn't realistic considering that this movie is old and he's aged, but it's still cool to see.
[code] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PxOVM8nMYtM [/code] (Skip to 1 minute and 53 seconds to see "Barney")
What do you think? Can you contribute other look-alikes to this thread?

item.title: Half-Life Look-Alikes
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Ajax:

Gordon Freeman: Edward Norton, Ewan McGregor, or an unknown.
Alyx: Michelle Rodriguez or Merle Dandridge
Eli Vance: Robert Guillaume or an unknown
Isaac Kleiner: Colin Mockery (j/k), David Hyde Pierce, or Dan Butler
Barney Calhoun: Matthew Broderick
G-Man: Bill Nighe or Robert Patrick
Dr. Wallace Breen: Sir Derek Jacobi, Dennis Hopper, or Helmut Bakaitis
Father Grigori: Jean Reno or a complete unknown
Judith Mossman: Julianne Moore or Julia Roberts
Odessa Cubbage: An unknown
Dr. Arne Magnusson: Ian Holm or David McCallum
Dr. Rosenberg (Blue Shift): Gary Oldman
Adrian Shepherd: Anyone who can act.

Morgan Freeman can’t work for Eli because Eli’s voice is slurred, and Morgan Freeman is too well-spoken, too clear in his speech. Freeman looks right, but can’t pull off the character vocally, which is just as important.

Christopher Walken can’t work for the G-Man because the GMan has a different speech pattern, while Walken is just heavily accented. Walken’s voice, while strange, does not work for the GMan.

Sean Connery is too old for Breen, and will not come out of retirement.

Nice list, but I would really hate for Michelle Rodriguez to play Alyx. She’s too…I dunno. Angry, I guess. Alyx is an upbeat woman. Maybe Rosario Dawson instead. Bill Nighy is strange enough to be Gman, and Robert Patrick is government enough, so I think either one would work. Also, Hugh Laurie looks plenty like Gordon, so he could play him (unless he has to speak, couldn’t imagine his voice for Gordon). Robert Guillaume should be Eli, he looks and (perfectly) sounds the part, although the man is now in his 80’s so time could be a factor with him.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life Look-Alikes
item.dc:creator: Coolm4n
item.description:
Sepulchre:

Did I say Hyneman? I’m sorry, I meant to say Adam Savage. The OTHER Mythbuster.
Gah. I’m confused. I really should be studying for my math exam right now or something, but this forum’s just so awesome…

S

Having the same hair and facial hair as someone does not mean to look like him. Some people just can’t understand it.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life Look-Alikes
item.dc:creator: J-Dude
item.description:
Excuse me? What moron was just dissing Escape from City 17? Are you even aware of the level of effects prowess that was pulled off there? Not to mention perfect use of film locations.

Please, these guys used flawless camera tracking, first-rate compositing and jaw-dropping particle and simulation effects to pull off the money shots. Not to mention the seamless object tracking used to give the Metrocops their helmets, and in part 2, for Headcrabs on the zombies. I don’t know who you’re trying to fool, it was perfect execution of location, costume and special effects that in the end had the precise vibe of Episode 1. Valve loved it, and even brought them on for something, and who the Hell are YOU to second guess Valve?

Read full topic
